revised_title: Observations on the Changes in Ancient Copper Alloys
tldr: The author examines the changes that occur in ancient copper alloys, specifically focusing on the incrustation and crystalline structures formed on artifacts. He discusses the composition of these incrustations and suggests that the mineralizing process may be due to the motion and separation of particles in the original compound, potentially involving chemical affinity, electro-chemical attraction, and attraction of aggregation.
